--- title: Graph tools keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Functions for general graph manipulation and property checking" ---
{% raw %}

Utilities¶

non_pendant_edges[source]

non_pendant_edges(G)

Returns all non pendant edges of a graph G

is_pendant[source]

is_pendant(G, edge)

Checks if edge is pendant in the graph G

has_isolated_nodes[source]

has_isolated_nodes(G)

Checks if the graph G has isolated nodes

edges_removed[source]

edges_removed(G, Gp)

If Gp is made by removing edges from G this method will return a list of those edges

Spectral¶

The normalised Laplacian of a graph $\mathcal{G}$ is given by $$\mathcal{L}(\mathcal{G}) = \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if }u=v \text{ and } d_u > 0 \\ \frac{-1}{\sqrt{d_ud_v}} & \text{if }u \sim v \\ 0 & otherwise \end{cases} $$

In this convention the diagonal entry is always $1$ unless the graph has isolated nodes in which case the entries are $0$ at those nodes. By setting setdiag=True then the diagonal entries will always be $1$ (even in the case of isolated nodes)

laplacian[source]

laplacian(G, setdiag=False)

Laplacian matrix of the graph G
